Flavius on Gab: 'We need verifiable elections, not meaningless audits after the election.
The 2020 election is over. It's been nine months since the election and not a single vote has been changed. The next election cycle has already started. There is fraud in every election because our election process is not verifiable. No Democrat or Republican politician is talking about fixing our corrupt voting process to eliminate fraud in the future. Why not?? #VerifiedElections

How should our voting systems work?
Voters should register to vote using Real ID (or one of its equivalents like a US Passport) so only citizens can vote, Real ID (https://www.dhs.gov/real-id) already exists, but is not used for voting yet.  Why not??
Every registered voter should be added to Electronic Registration Information Center (ERIC) so that a voter can only register once and vote only in a single precinct. ERIC (https://ericstates.org/) already exits, but is not used by all states for all voters yet.  Why not??
After voting every voter should be able to log in to ERIC and verify that their ballot was correctly added to the reported election results after the election. You know, just like you log into your bank account to view your checks and balance or your credit card account to verify your charges. This does not exist.  Why not?? It could be added to the ERIC system.
Americans need to start demanding verifiable elections. Every voter should be able to verify their own ballot in every election. Every voter should be able to download all non-identifiable ballots and add the results for themselves in a spreadsheet. That way auditing each ballot is done by the voter who cast that ballot and every voter can verify the totals.'

A major regional hospital chain in Mass.:

UMass Memorial Health fires 200 caregivers who refused to get COVID vaccination

WORCESTER — UMass Memorial Health fired more than 200 caregivers who refused to get vaccinated for COVID-19, CEO and President Dr. Eric Dickson said Friday.

“Sadly, we did terminate over 200 people for not getting vaccinated,” Dickson confirmed Friday in an interview. “We could have used them because we need everyone we have right now.”

UMass Memorial Health’s roughly 15,000 employees faced a Nov. 1 deadline to get vaccinated or to receive an exemption, after which they were placed on unpaid leave if they did not get a shot.

_source.content:
Uh oh. Merkel...

Pecresse Wins French Conservative Ticket for Presidential Election

https://www.theepochtimes.com/pecresse-wins-french-conservative-ticket-for-presidential-election_4139006.html

PARIS—Valerie Pecresse, who has described herself as "one-third Thatcher, two-thirds Merkel," has won the French conservative Les Republicains (LR) ticket for the 2022 presidential election and will now aim to thwart Emmanuel Macron's reelection bid. Opinion polls have so far shown the 54-year-old head of the Paris Ile-de-France region winning about 11 percent of the votes at best in next April's election, giving her little chance of making it to a second-round runoff, let alone winning it. With nearly 61 percent of the votes in a runoff, Pecresse beat right-winger Eric Ciotti for the LR ticket, the party said after a primary that was a test of whether it would remain anchored in its centre-right tradition or lurch to the right. "We are going to restore France's pride and protect the French," Pecresse said at the party's headquarters shortly after the results were announced. Pecresse can potentially appeal to the ...

_source.content: This Is How You Bounce Back Bigly: Capitals Beat Blue Jackets 3-1The Washington Capitals came into Saturday’s game against the Columbus Blue Jackets on a rare losing streak this season. Could they make sure that streak remained at only two games? Pish... heck yeah!Here's the brief scoring summary.Capitals Forward Aliaksei Protas wristed one to the roof to open the scoring. Then Caps' captain and #PlayingLegend Alex Ovechkin scored his 750th career goal (because, of course) to double the Caps lead.(I was at the game and it was electric. This Is How You Bounce Back Bigly: Capitals Beat Blue Jackets 3-1

The Washington Capitals came into Saturday’s game against the Columbus Blue Jackets on a rare losing streak this season. Could they make sure that streak remained at only two games? Pish... heck yeah!

Here's the brief scoring summary.

Capitals Forward Aliaksei Protas wristed one to the roof to open the scoring. Then Caps' captain and #PlayingLegend Alex Ovechkin scored his 750th career goal (because, of course) to double the Caps lead.

(I was at the game and it was electric. We refused to let the game continue until Ovi retook the ice to recognize our applause. Baby oh baby.)

There are only three other players in NHL history who have scored more: Wayne Gretzky, Gordie Howe and Jaromir Jagr. The #Great8's lamp lighter marks his first career goal against goaltender Daniil Tarasov, the 152nd goaltender Ovechkin has scored against in his career.

Ovechkin has become the seventh player in NHL history to reach 20 goals in 17 straight seasons. Only two players have hit the 20-goal mark in more than 17 consecutive campaigns: Gordie Howe (22 from 1949-50—1970-71) and Brendan Shanahan (19 from 1988-89—2007-08).

Then Blue Jacket's winger Eric Robinson cut the lead in half in the third by netting one past Capital goalie Ilya Samsonov. Finally, it was Washington winger Garnet Hathaway with the empty netter.

With this win, the Caps grab a badly needed two standings points to maintain their first place lead in the Metropolitan Division with 36 points. They are 6-2-2 in their last 10 games.

Next Up: The good guys in red stay right at home here in D.C. and take on the Anaheim Ducks on Monday night. I'll be at the game and will post a full report.

Capitals Beat Blue Jackets 3-1!
#ALLCAPS

_source.contentraw:
Chorus: Solvet sæclum in favilla (Shall consume the world in ashes)
Dies iræ, dies illa (Day of wrath, that day)

Stop! Cries Eric Zenmour.
> This is stolen land it shall welcome all but those whom it belongs!
Look at the misery you have brought to shadows of Notre Dame!
> I am guiltless for it is perfect utopia I've pursued!
And now you would smear your faeces on the walls of Notre Dame.
> My ideology is clear.
You can lie to yourself and your minions,
How nothing produces a sense of qualm,
But you cannot hide the works before our eyes,
What you plastered on the walls of Notre Dame.

Chorus: Allahu akbar!

A life time spent on believing in absolute power and control.

Chorus: Allahu akbar!

The socialist feels a twinge of fear,
He realises his own reek is foul.
> What must we do?
Undo the damage and return it to how it was.
> What? Undo the harm that has left society broken and misshapen?
> Very well, we might consider repairing this one tourist attraction.
This one tourist attraction?
> We are people of nowhere.
> Better ideas must be locked away where none can see,
> Censorship and silence affords every tyrant their means and ways,
> And perhaps this base temple may,
> Yet prove one day,
> Of use to us.

And the media gives a man a cruel name,
They will mock his visage as one of Quasimodo,
But now there is a riddle to guess if you can,
What has happened to bells of Notre Dame,
Will they be rang by a socialist monster or by hands of man?

Chorus: Will we hear the bells, bells, bells, bells
Bells, bells, bells, bells
Bells of Notre Dame!

#Poem #PoemADay #Poetry #SongParody #EricZenmour

'Never Seen Anything Like It': Los Angeles Residents Stunned As Violent Crimes Creep Into Wealthier Communities

After two years of rising crime in Los Angeles, residents of upscale neighborhoods are finally starting to freak out after a spate of 'flash mob' lootings at high-end retail stores have been accompanied with a disturbing increase in violent crimes committed in the suburbs, according to the LA Times.

Crews of burglars publicly smashing their way into Los Angeles’ most exclusive stores. Robbers following their victims, including a star of “The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills” and a BET host, to their residences. And this week, the fatal shooting of 81-year-old Jacqueline Avant, an admired philanthropist and wife of music legend Clarence Avant, in her Beverly Hills home.

...these incidents have sparked a national conversation and led to local concern about both the crimes themselves and where the outrage over the violence will lead.

"The fact that this has happened, her being shot and killed in her own home, after giving, sharing, and caring for 81 years has shaken the laws of the Universe," said Oprah Winfrey, expressing grief over Avant's killing via Twitter. "The world is upside down."

The Times notes that while overall crime rates within Los Angeles remain far below the notoriously violent 1990s, much of it has been concentrated in poor communities - so it receives virtually no attention. Now that crime has "crept up in wealthier enclaves and thrust its way to the center of public discourse" across the city.

Turning point?

In 2020, polls showed that California voters largely supported criminal justice reform, as well as rolling back tough sentencing laws to reduce prison populations without nary a thought to how it might affect the crime rate. Now, those concerned about crime and blame liberal policies for its rise are growing more vocal.

For others, it's been a serious wake-up call.

"I have never seen anything like it," said Dominick DeLuca, owner of the Brooklyn Projects skateboard shop on Melrose Avenue where burglaries and robberies have seen a sharp enough spike in recent months that he's now carrying a gun to work. "In the last two years, I have been broken into three times."

On Thursday, Mayor Eric Garcetti and LAPD Chief Michael Moore advocated for locking offenders up, and questioned several pandemic-related policies that put nonviolent arrestees back on the street without bail.

https://youtu.be/BSCKB9kWnbo
https://www.zerohedge.com/political/never-seen-anything-it-los-angeles-residents-stunned-violent-crimes-creep-wealthier

card.description: As U.S. President Joe Biden prepares to host more than 100 participants in the initial "Summit for Democracy", China - which was not invited - has increasingly talked up the advantages of its own "whole-process democracy".  Chinese state media and diplomats in recent weeks have ramped up criticism of democracy in the United States, touting what they describe as preferable outcomes in its system of "socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics" on measures ranging from COVID-19 management to social mobility.  Communist Party-ruled China, widely considered to have become increasingly authoritarian under President Xi Jinping, first used the phrase "whole-process democracy" in 2019, and the concept was enshrined in law this past March.
card.title: As U.S. promotes democracy, China touts its own version

_source.content:
William Yang
@WilliamYang120

As #US. President Joe #Biden prepares to host more than 100 participants in the initial "#SummitforDemocracy", #China - which was not invited - has increasingly talked up the advantages of its own "whole-process democracy". https://news.yahoo.com/u-promotes-democracy-china-touts-110835903.html
#Chinese statemedia and diplomats in recent weeks have ramped up criticism of democracy in the #UnitedStates, touting what they describe as preferable outcomes in its system of "socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics" ...
... on measures ranging from #COVID19 management to social mobility.
Vice Foreign Minister #LeYucheng described the Washington event as the "very opposite of democracy" because, he said, it is divisive and "points fingers" at other countries.
"China's whole-process people's democracy is not the kind that wakes up at the time of voting and goes back to dormant afterwards," Le told foreign media at an event in #Beijing on Thursday.
China, which will release a white paper on democracy on Saturday, defines its version as consultative, with voting permitted at the very local level and public feedback collected before any law is implemented.
The definition does not include an independent judiciary, free media, or universal suffrage for national office.
"#Xi has long used the claim that party's governance is superior to that of the West in order to legitimise the party's monopoly of power," Charles Parton, a former #British diplomat and a senior associate fellow at the Royal United Services Institute, told Reuters
Asked at Thursday's event why #Beijing seems obsessed with comparing itself to #Washington, Eric Li, a Chinese venture capitalist who founded a current affairs website known for its nationalistic stance, joked: "We are just unhappy we didn't get invited to the party next week."
